rules.natural: If paper1 was submitted, then paper1 was rejected.
Either paper1 was submitted or a keynote speech by the Turing Award winner has been scheduled.
Provided that research1 relates to quantum computing, the research in paper1 is novel or the methodology in paper1 is sound.
Under the condition that conference icml is prestigious, research1 is an AI application or research1 relates to quantum computing.

Provided that the committee voted for conference1, then if the chair decided for conference1, an extension was granted for conference1, or in case the deadline for conference1 is approaching, paper1 has statistical significance or the experiments in paper1 are not valid.
Under the condition that ethics approval was granted for conference1, a sponsor intervened in conference1 or the committee voted for conference1.
If plagiarism was found in paper1, then it is not the case that paper1 was rejected.
Provided that data in paper1 was fabricated, then paper1 was not rejected.
Whenever an investigation was launched by committee1, plagiarism was found in paper1 or data in paper1 was fabricated.
Under the condition that an automated check was performed by system1, plagiarism was found in paper1 or data in paper1 was fabricated.
Acceptance was notified to author1 or the process for review1 is not completed.
Provided that the camera-ready version was submitted for paper1, then the final version was uploaded for paper1.
Either the camera-ready version was submitted for paper1 or a withdrawal was requested for paper1.
Under the condition that a withdrawal was requested for paper1, then acceptance was not notified to author1.
If the final version was uploaded for paper1, then a presentation was scheduled for paper1.
Whenever paper1 has a theoretical contribution, the research in paper1 is novel.
Paper1 has a theoretical contribution or paper1 has a practical implementation.
Provided that paper1 has a practical implementation, software was released for paper1.
If the research in paper1 is novel, then it is not the case that paper1 was rejected.
The dataset for paper1 is public or if software was released for paper1, then the methodology in paper1 is sound.
If paper1 received a desk rejection, then paper1 has a scope mismatch.
Under the condition that paper1 received a desk rejection, paper1 does not have a scope mismatch.
Provided that the methodology in paper1 is sound, paper1 was not rejected.
If paper1 includes experiments, then the experiments in paper1 are valid.
Paper1 includes experiments or the research in paper1 is novel or the methodology in paper1 is sound.
The reviewer had a positive opinion of paper1, or paper1 has statistical significance, or the experiments in paper1 are not valid.
Whenever research1 is an AI application, the research in paper1 is novel or the methodology in paper1 is sound.
If it is not the case that an investigation was launched by committee1 or an automated check was performed by system1, then the process for review1 has been completed.
Under the condition that it is not the case that the research in paper1 is novel or the methodology in paper1 is sound, then paper1 received a desk rejection.

(A1 → A2).natural: If paper1 was submitted, then paper1 was rejected.

(A1 ∨ G).natural: Either paper1 was submitted or a keynote speech by the Turing Award winner has been scheduled.

(A10 → (A3 ∨ A4)).natural: Provided that research1 relates to quantum computing, the research in paper1 is novel or the methodology in paper1 is sound.

(A11 → (A9 ∨ A10)).natural: Under the condition that conference icml is prestigious, research1 is an AI application or research1 relates to quantum computing.

(A12 → (A7 ∨ ¬A6)).natural: Whenever the deadline for conference1 is approaching, paper1 has statistical significance or the experiments in paper1 are not valid.

(A13 ∨ (A12 → (A7 ∨ ¬A6))).natural: An extension was granted for conference1, or if the deadline for conference1 is approaching, then paper1 has statistical significance or the experiments in paper1 are not valid.

(A14 → (A13 ∨ (A12 → (A7 ∨ ¬A6)))).natural: If the chair decided for conference1, then an extension was granted for conference1, or under the condition that the deadline for conference1 is approaching, paper1 has statistical significance or the experiments in paper1 are not valid.

(A15 → (A14 → (A13 ∨ (A12 → (A7 ∨ ¬A6))).natural: Provided that the committee voted for conference1, then if the chair decided for conference1, an extension was granted for conference1, or in case the deadline for conference1 is approaching, paper1 has statistical significance or the experiments in paper1 are not valid.

(A16 ∨ A15).natural: A sponsor intervened in conference1 or the committee voted for conference1.

(A17 → (A16 ∨ A15)).natural: Under the condition that ethics approval was granted for conference1, a sponsor intervened in conference1 or the committee voted for conference1.

(A18 → ¬A2).natural: If plagiarism was found in paper1, then it is not the case that paper1 was rejected.

(A18 ∨ A19).natural: Either plagiarism was found in paper1 or data in paper1 was fabricated.

(A19 → ¬A2).natural: Provided that data in paper1 was fabricated, then paper1 was not rejected.

(A20 → (A18 ∨ A19)).natural: Whenever an investigation was launched by committee1, plagiarism was found in paper1 or data in paper1 was fabricated.

(A20 ∨ A21).natural: An investigation was launched by committee1 or an automated check was performed by system1.

(A21 → (A18 ∨ A19)).natural: Under the condition that an automated check was performed by system1, plagiarism was found in paper1 or data in paper1 was fabricated.

(A23 ∨ ¬A22).natural: Acceptance was notified to author1 or the process for review1 is not completed.

(A24 ∨ ¬A23).natural: A presentation was scheduled for paper1 or acceptance was not notified to author1.

(A25 → A24).natural: If the camera-ready version was submitted for paper1, then a presentation was scheduled for paper1.

(A25 → A27).natural: Provided that the camera-ready version was submitted for paper1, then the final version was uploaded for paper1.

(A25 ∨ A26).natural: Either the camera-ready version was submitted for paper1 or a withdrawal was requested for paper1.

(A26 → ¬A23).natural: Under the condition that a withdrawal was requested for paper1, then acceptance was not notified to author1.

(A27 → A24).natural: If the final version was uploaded for paper1, then a presentation was scheduled for paper1.

(A28 → A3).natural: Whenever paper1 has a theoretical contribution, the research in paper1 is novel.

(A28 ∨ A29).natural: Paper1 has a theoretical contribution or paper1 has a practical implementation.

(A29 → A30).natural: Provided that paper1 has a practical implementation, software was released for paper1.

(A29 → A4).natural: Under the condition that paper1 has a practical implementation, the methodology in paper1 is sound.

(A3 → ¬A2).natural: If the research in paper1 is novel, then it is not the case that paper1 was rejected.

(A3 ∨ A4).natural: The research in paper1 is novel or the methodology in paper1 is sound.

(A30 → A4).natural: Whenever software was released for paper1, the methodology in paper1 is sound.

(A31 ∨ (A30 → A4)).natural: The dataset for paper1 is public or if software was released for paper1, then the methodology in paper1 is sound.

(A32 → A33).natural: If paper1 received a desk rejection, then paper1 has a scope mismatch.

(A32 → ¬A33).natural: Under the condition that paper1 received a desk rejection, paper1 does not have a scope mismatch.

(A4 → ¬A2).natural: Provided that the methodology in paper1 is sound, paper1 was not rejected.

(A5 → A6).natural: If paper1 includes experiments, then the experiments in paper1 are valid.

(A5 ∨ (A3 ∨ A4)).natural: Paper1 includes experiments or the research in paper1 is novel or the methodology in paper1 is sound.

(A7 ∨ ¬A6).natural: Either paper1 has statistical significance or the experiments in paper1 are not valid.

(A8 ∨ (A7 ∨ ¬A6)).natural: The reviewer had a positive opinion of paper1, or paper1 has statistical significance, or the experiments in paper1 are not valid.

(A9 → (A3 ∨ A4)).natural: Whenever research1 is an AI application, the research in paper1 is novel or the methodology in paper1 is sound.

(A9 ∨ A10).natural: Research1 is an AI application or research1 relates to quantum computing.

(¬(A20 ∨ A21) → A22).natural: If it is not the case that an investigation was launched by committee1 or an automated check was performed by system1, then the process for review1 has been completed.

(¬(A3 ∨ A4) → A32).natural: Under the condition that it is not the case that the research in paper1 is novel or the methodology in paper1 is sound, then paper1 received a desk rejection.

A11.natural: The conference named icml is prestigious.

A12.natural: The deadline for conference named conference1 is approaching.

A14.natural: The chair made a decision for conference named conference1.

A15.natural: The committee voted for conference named conference1.

A17.natural: Ethics approval was granted for conference named conference1.

G.natural: A keynote speech by the Turing Award winner has been scheduled.

¬A1.natural: It is not the case that paper1 was submitted.

¬A13.natural: It is not the case that an extension was granted for conference1.

¬A16.natural: It is not the case that a sponsor intervened in conference1.

¬A2.natural: It is not the case that paper1 was rejected.

¬A22.natural: The process for review1 has not been completed.

¬A23.natural: Acceptance was not notified to author1.

¬A24.natural: A presentation was not scheduled for paper1.

¬A31.natural: The dataset for paper1 is not public.

¬A32.natural: It is not the case that paper1 received a desk rejection.

¬A6.natural: The experiments in paper1 are not valid.

¬A7.natural: Paper1 does not have statistical significance.

¬A8.natural: The reviewer did not have a positive opinion of paper1.
